title-group.article-title: Computation of Jacobsthal's Function h(n) for n < 50

abstract.p: Let j(n) denote the smallest positive integer m such that every sequence of m consecutive integers contains an integer prime to n. Let <tex-math>$P_n $</tex-math> be the product of the first n primes and define <tex-math>$h(n) = j(P_n )$</tex-math> . Presently, h(n) is only known for n ≤ 24. In this paper, we describe an algorithm that enabled the calculation of h(n) for n < 50.
